oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Panoramic photograph of the 114th Field Artillery
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The 114th Field Artillery was part of the 30th Div. and was composed of Tennesse National Guardsmen and Luke Lea, a powerful newspaper man and politico, commanded the battery. Lea spearheaded an attempt to kidnap Kaiser Wilhelm II after the armistice. The image belonged to 1st Class Machinist Robert Jackson, Supply Co., 114th FA and he is presumed to be in the image. Jackson was born in Dekalb County but lived most of his life in Wilson County. The photogrpher is M.C. Mayberry of Chattanooga, Tenn.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
